page.title: 01Crowle & Land to the East
page.content: The area is mainly flat and agricultural and has the expanding village of Crowle on its western side. There are two small hamlets, Sale Green and Huddington in the N of the area which is split NS by the main watercoutse of Bow Brook. Two large houses, Huddington Court Frospere Court lie close to Bow Brook as does Bow Wood. Several minor roads cross the area but in the south east corner the Worcester to Stratford road passes through. The work force is split between those commuting to work in the large urban areas such as Worcester, Droitwich and Birmingham, and those working in the local farming industry.
